reviews.sentence: Everything the fact they fixing up the hotel is nice. Remodeling all the rooms is nice. I would not mind going back when they are nice. No hairdryer in the room but it say they have hairdryer. Not.
You get what you pay for. Good for 1 2 nights. Near downtown Cobo Icehockey. Polite staff clean room but need to be renovated. Seems that the hotel is will be soon under reconstruction.

I will try after renovation. I was given an upgrade. The hotel is under renovation the model displayed looks great and indeed must. Hotel is old and overpriced towels dingy the fridge smelled from being disconnected. I will try them after the renovation. Great that there were no bugs.

Lovely place. I stayed one night at the Hotel in one of their bright new renovated bedrooms. The hotel is now under new management and they are currently renovating the rooms. I was happy to stay in one of their new concept rooms with a really cool industrial design. The location is perfect. Close to the awesome district of Corktown where you can find the coolest restaurants bars of the city. You can walk to the Riverfront or Downtown Detroit in 20 min. When you stay there make sure you meet with Suzete. She is a great host and is full of great ideas for what to do in the city. Plus the hotel has free parking.

Great stay at the Corktown. I stayed at the Corktown Hotel while performing in Detroit and was so pleasantly surprised by the friendliness of the hotel staff and the comfort of my room. Their renovating right now and going out of their way to ensure guest satisfaction. The are of Corktown also has a bunch of wonderful places to eat try Gold Cash Gold plus a gym that is less than a 10 minute walk from the hotel Detroit Tough. I had definitely recommend this hotel to friends and have already done so.

The Corktown is getting better. Third time at the Corktown. New ownership thing are changing for the good. Great staff rooms are being renovated. Sadly the much talked about vending machines selling underwear have been removed. Found great restaurants within 10 minute walk. One open 24 hours with great food. Will go bak again.

In town for the Garth Brooks show. Was in town for the Garth Brooks show and decided to stay here. It was nice to see that you have plans to renovate. Your property definitely needs it. We had a good stay though. The staff was very nice and helpful. I do not think the maintenance guy left the whole time we were there. Nice guy. I come to Detroit occasionally for sporting events and concerts so I will probably give this hotel another shot. It seems like you might be on the right track to make it a better hotel for your guests and your employees.

My friends I stayed over the weekend for a concert back in February. Everyone was very nice friendly especially the maintenance man whom we consistently saw in the hall ways coming in and out of rooms. If you had any problems what so ever all you had to do was let them know and they took care of it right away. We were shown much hospitality. Thank you all for the stay.

Pleasant. The Location and price were convenient for the purposes of my travel. I understand there are renovations planned but it suited my needs. I felt nervous about the elevator. It was noisy and slow. I think it is in need of maintenance. The access to the parking is in need of maintenance as well.

Detroit. I Love You. Aw Detroit. I have seen you evolve and devolve over the past 14 years and last seven visits only to see something new and beautiful evolve once again out of your ashes and urban decay. I knew you would come around again so I saddled up and flew out for my favorite time of year the Detroit Electronic Music Festival or Movement as it has been called in recent years. The difference this year. I am older now and wanting to really check out Detroit and be a touch away from Hart Plaza where all of the festivities and noise are located. I thought I might stay in Corktown the oldest neighborhood in Detroit and see what all of the fuss was about. Thus I chose the Corktown Hotel which touts itself as a part of Detroit is history and is located in this historic neighborhood near many landmarks and newly sprouted restaurants. After some confusion about prices sometimes the websites that sell rooms for hotels do not always communicate with the hotel itself. I work at a hotel and it happens all of the time. Suzete graciously showed me to my newly remodeled room. And what a room it was. The room itself was made up of refurbished items everything from a rustic modern desk to the lamps which looked like they were made out of piping. The bed frame seemed to be made of refurbished wood with melted glass details. This along with with a large flat screen tv a modern chair and futon and modern touches in the bathroom made our room feel more like a cool uptown apartment than an old hotel. We felt at ease and at home instantly. Much like Detroit the Corktown Hotel is being renovated one space at a time so they do not have a lot of newly renovated rooms yet but that is the beauty of it. You get to be part of the renaissance happening in Detroit just by visiting. You are supporting the economy and staying in a historic part of town and helping revive a cool old school hotel. So ask for a newly renovated room when you do stay there. And before you go remember to do some research about local restaurants and bars Slows BQ Mudgies Sandwich shop ect.

Will be nice after the renovation. In it is current condition it is very run down. Their plans for renovation look great though and I will be interested in checking it out then. Hotel staff were awesome.
ok stay. The stay was nice but i was shocked when i got there and I had to pay a 500 deposit. I did not see that on the web site. It will be nice when they finish the remodeling.

Poor. They plan to renovate this hotel. The girl at the front desk was very sweet however this hotel is yucky can not think of a better word. Hopefully they get things done because it is in a convenient location.

Just sleeping good place. Staying longer well after remodel will be good. Staff was excellent. Things will be better once the remodel is complete. The oldness of the rooms but they are in process of remodel and will be real nice once it is completed.

Great Value Lovely Stay. My friend and I stayed here for one night while we were in town for a concert. We were pleasantly surprised on the newly remodeled and styled rooms. Free parking was also a huge plus. Room was very clean with all new decor fresh sheets and fluffy slippers and robes. We found a great deal through Express Deals on Priceline but I would expect the price of this hotel will go up as they continue to establish themselves and finish renovations. All rooms have been remodeled but they are still working on hallways elevators and eventually a restaurant. Uber to Ford Field was only a 5 minute drive and cost somewhere around 5.

Nice vibe coming along well. Stayed there for work recently. I always like to try and find smaller more interesting hotels when traveling and this renovation in progress did not disappoint. Note that the planned restaurant is not open yet and only 2 of 4 floors are renovated but the look is simple industrial style design. In addition to a row of restaurants bars and shops open on nearby Michigan Ave there is Mudgies and Atwater Brew pub open in the nearby neighborhood for local dining. Not in the heart of downtown but just outside of it.

Comfortable stay in the D. We arrived in Detroit for a two day trip and chose the Trumbull hotel. The hotel is located in a quiet section of Detroit and has free parking. If you do not think free parking is a perk just wait until you head downtown Detroit to sight see. Most parking is between 10 20 The hotels exterior and interior were clean and tastefully decorated. The front staff was polite and thoughtful. No issues checking in or out. However the room we were in did not have curtains. We told the front staff and they were apologetic and quick to make sure we were satisfied. They ended up moving us to a new room which I did not think was necessary but was a nice gesture. Luckily we got to view two different rooms the reviews are the same for both. The room itself was small but cozy and clean. We did not hear any street noise or noise from other guests. The pictures online match what it looks like in person. The mini fridge was clean. There are plenty of mirrors in the room and it is well lit. Overall this is a nice place to stay if you want comfort and quality. A previous reviewer mentioned that the room was good for a prisoner. I think the opinion is exaggerated. Yes the walls are white but it gives the illusion of a larger space design 101. We rested our heads and were pleased during our stay. One must remember that this hotel is a work in progress and so far we they are doing a fabulous job. Much respect to this hotel for trying to revitalize Detroit. The next time we are in Detroit we had definitely return. PS to Hotel Management Hopefully there are no future plans to install carpet because we liked the refurbished cement floors. We thought it was a great design choice. I loathe carpet and there is nothing worse than visiting a hotel and wondering what is on in the carpet.

Well worth the money. Stayed 04Aug16. Hotel is in the middle of renovations. Rooms are uncarpeted and somewhat Spartan European but overall very roomy and comfortable. The king size bed was to die for. At this time they do not have a restaurant attached maybe as part of the renovation6 cab fare to Fox Theatre.

Half is not better than none. Half way renovated but done poorly. Dirty hallways. Dirty guest room floor. Hair on bed. Exterior security doors do not lock so anyone can just walk in at any hour of the night. Lot of lipstick went on this building. Stay somewhere else.

Clean modern and quirky. A recently renovated hotel in corks town Detroit. Rooms and hotel are very modern and minimalistic but even so so much character. Area seems safe too we walked into old part of corkstown and area seems clean and tidy would recommend and quite well located if your not sure about walking to centre it is 5bucks in a taxi in middle of night.
Renovated in an industrial flea market flip style. Drove past it at first. The exterior is deceiving. Not too far from night life.
Room was clean and trendy. Walls were very thin. Hotel opened one year ago and they are still renovating rooms. Location is a bit away from most destinations.

Stayed 15 Days. This is one of Detroit is best kept secrets. Although they are 072017 still under minor renovations this is still a Must Visit. The newly opened restaurant is Awesome Please try the Tartar Awesome. No major problems the few minor problems solved quickly. The Staff A all were welcoming and very kind. This is a must for a couples date night when they add the courtyard entertaining. Will return.

Stay cation. I am a native Detroiter making a point to stay at the new downtown area hotels. This was a cool place with a trendy industrial vibe. Renovations really brought out the industrial elements associated with the city while integrating modern tones. The courtyard was very relaxing. Only complaint was the thin walls and therefore higher than desired noise levels.

Rooms were clean and very modern. The beds and linens were nice. I like what they were going for with the relatively recent remodel but their execution seemed spotty. The moldings along the floor of the rooms were often crooked or slightly too long. The room doors do not fit their frames so light and sound leak through. there is also plenty of paint imperfections ie splotches where there should not be and chipping paint along corners. Some of the paint imperfections could be by aesthetic choice but it came across as more lazy and unprofessional when also considering the other flaws. I think the same modern industrial theme aesthetic would have still come acros loud and clear even with more careful use of painters tape. We also could not get cold water to run from any faucet only warm or hot. So warm drinking water while probably healthier is not what I am accustom to. 45 stars may be generous but it deserves it because I really like what they were going for and I hope they can smooth out the rough edges. This place is worth a try.

The location is very convenient. It is an easy pickup location for Uber. Or you can walk to downtown without issue. The staff is very friendly. The rooms are redone but fairly small. The floors are concrete. There is not a lot of furniture. The rooms are cozy and very warm. The setup works very well for couples. Overall we found a lot of value between the location price and amenities. This place is a worthy stay for one or two people. The room setup and experience may be different for a larger group.

What hospitality should be. This past week my wife and I booked two rooms at Trumbull and Porter. Our aim was to be in a good location for exploring Cork Town and Midtown where our son plans to live in a few months. T and P is the perfect hotel for this purpose. The hotel itself has undergone a top to bottom renovation in recent years and it is evident that the work is still in progress. We loved being there though and did not mind skirting the workers who were busy installing new windows in the hallway leading to the elevator. This is a hotel for travelers who want something that is quite a bit different from the lackluster design of the cookie cutter motor inns that dot the freeways. Trumbull and Porter is a design forward hotel pleasing to the eye and extraordinarily functional. The rooms although small are clean comfortable and pleasant. The bar restaurant and lovely outdoor spaces provide great lounging options for guests. Travelers can even enjoy hanging out in the lobby featuring a wall with David Blairs wonderful Ode to Detroit emblazoned upon it. Also in the lobby I enjoyed paging through and reading from books about the rebirth of the city. In fact I have since purchased two of them. One of them Detroit. The Dream is Now is a wonderful tribute to the great design renovation and rich history of the city. It makes you want to live there and be part of the vibrant renaissance that is currently well underway there. The book features photos of many places that are actually near the hotel some within walking distance. The entertainment options nearby are unparalleled too. The restaurants in particular are amazing. Several notable places are within walking distance or a very short drive from the hotel. In fact one might even use one of the cool bicycles that are available for guests to explore the immediate area. I can not say enough about the staff at Trumbull and Porter. Everybody there understands the essence of hospitality. Everybody. Front desk housekeeping bar tenders servers groundskeepers all were so cordial and helpful. We even had a nice conversation with the manager one morning. Of the fabulous Nina who anchors the lobby as barista concierge extraordinaire he said is not she great. it is like coming home. Indeed.
did not realize they had renovated this hotel its looks very nice.

good party hotel but not for anything else. I have a love hate relationship with this place. Management is super nice and acomodatingThey have a very nice modern lobby and bar which is nicer than what you are paying for so if you wana meet a date in the lobby it is perfect for that you can impress without breaking the bank. However on the other hand the quality of the rooms and amenities is LESS than what you are paying for. The mattresses are not very comfortable and the sheets are not cotton which is a huge comfort factor for me. There is no coffee maker in the room and no free coffee in the lobby they expect you to pay 3 4 dollars for a coffee. Also there was a lot of imperfections in the room like fixtures that were moved and the previous holes were not repaired properly or at all. It just seemed like their maintenance guy who does small repairs is totally unprofessional and doing repairs at a college frat house level. The thing that really rubbed me the wrong way and was sorta the last straw to make me reduce my rating from 4 to 3 was the prices they charge in their pantry. 6 dollars for a cheap tiny little frozen burrito. even 4star hotels do not upcharge that much. So basically if you are getting a hotel to party downtown for a night go to an event or meet a date I highly recommend this place. 55. but if you are doing an extended stay past 2 days or a business trip and just want a relaxing comfortable place I would give 25 for that kind of stay. So averaging to about 35.
100 recommend. The renovations have completely changed this place for the best.

Solid option if you want the Detroit vibe without being right downtown with good food and open vibe. Location was just what we were looking for w Batch Brewing right next door and close but not right in downtown. Service checking in and out was great real people. Good wifi. Comfortable bed and good heating. Design is just about right. you can tell it was nt made yesterday but its got the right amount of remodeling and let us be cool and up to date without being obnoxious. nicely balanced. good outdoor area too. A dirty Q Tip and scraps of paper outside the door did not do much for our first impression and the first cleaning staffer that came up to deal with that was not appropriately responsive but other folks we met over the course of our 24 hours there were great. No coffee in room is a downer and pretty rare in this cafeinated day and age. particularly when breakfast is not included.
